title: Seaports May Be Crux Of Israeli-Palestinian Peace
teaser: NPR's Alice Fordham explains why Gazans want more fishing rights, and why Israel is limiting fishermen's access to the sea.
contentencoded:
The conflict between Israel and Hamas seems to have calmed in between ceasefires.

While Israeli and Palestinian leaders talk peace in Cairo, NPR’s Alice Fordham joins Here & Now’s Robin Young to talk about what life is like in Gaza, both inside people’s homes and on the sea, a major point of contention in peace talks.

Meanwhile, in Iraq, the Mosul dam has been captured by ISIS forces. Fordham talks about her trip there earlier this month, and why the insurgents’ hold on the dam could be so detrimental.

Guest

  • Alice Fordham, international correspondent for NPR. She tweets @AliceFordham.
